newsitem.title: FRANCE: Jospin prepares policy speech to French parliament.
newsitem.headline: Jospin prepares policy speech to French parliament.

text.p: Socialist Prime Minister Lionel Jospin is expected to hold a special cabinet meeting on Thursday in preparation for his general statement of policy to parliament later in the month, a spokesman said on Saturday.
France's new head of government will address parliament on his programme between June 18 and June 20, Jospin aide Manuel Valls told reporters.
Government spokeswoman Catherine Trautmann said last week Jospin's cabinet, announced on Wednesday evening, was already at work compiling a list of tasks and priorities for Jospin's new government.
The general statement of policy is intended as an outline of the new government's ambitions.
It traditionally is followed by a parliamentary vote on a motion of confidence in the new government.

Jospin, whose leftist government combines Socialists, Communists and Greens, took over in France after its surprise victory over the previous centre-right government in last Sunday's parliamentary election.
